text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.

I'm Aley Hammer, and today
we're joined with Ree Ram,
the CEO of iTrazo Tracetech.

Ree, thank you so much
for joining me today.

To start, can you share with
our audience who is iTrazo

and what services do
you guys actually offer?
- Thank you, Aley,

greatly appreciate you
having me here today,
and fantastic to be part of this show.
So who is iTrazo?
iTrazo, we are the pioneers

in developing supply chain
traceability solutions
to give our customers and brands control
over quality delivery.
So we've developed
our own supply chain traceability platform
called iTrazo ADI.

The ADI stands for
active digital identity,

which is attached to every
asset, product, or service,
to give cradle-to-grave transparency
of a product and service
as it goes through its entire life cycle.
We are delivering consumer confidence

through real time end-to-end
supply chain traceability

for transparency, compliance,
and consistent quality.
- And you mentioned that
you developed your traceability platform,
which is called iTrazo ADI.

Can you just elaborate
on that a little bit?

So, why did you actually
develop your own solution?
- So consumer confidence,
and you as a consumer are fully aware

that growing consumer
demands for quality product,

understanding where their
products coming from,
the brand protection, the food safety,
the biosecurity issues that are out there
cannot be met by fragmented supply chains,

or inadequate compliance, or
lack of quality management.
Hence, we developed a platform
that delivered consumer confidence

through real time end-to-end
supply chain traceability

for transparency, compliance,
and consistent quality.
We are also offering brand protection.

So, our platform allows brands
to protect their reputation

and also protect against product
diversion counterfeiting,
do targeted recalls,
and meet their compliance obligations,

and plus create transparency
in the supply chain ecosystem.

We've also got, within the whole
supply chain at the moment,
we are lacking data sharing.
So where the data producers

and the data consumers
meet and trade data,
it's a data trading economy
where we have created this for everybody

that plays a part in the
supply chain ecosystem.

On the other hand, as
you can see right now,

the supply chain is in chaos
caused by the pandemic.

This is another example of
why supply chain transparency

is critical to meet the
supply chain demand.
- Yeah, absolutely.
It definitely gives consumers confidence

knowing that we have
supply chain traceability.
And Ree, why did you select AWS

as your cloud and
managed service provider?

- When iTrazo started
it's journey in late 2017,

we evaluated different
solution architectures
and infrastructure requirements

that would be secure or
scalable, easy to maintain,
and cost effective for our customers
and us as a solution provider.
And in that evaluation process,

AWS ticked all the boxes
for us to get us started.

The iTrazo ADI platform
has several moving parts,
and we are processing huge volumes of data
in billions of transactions

from the entire ecosystem
that is involved.

And we are providing information
back to our customers
in near real time.

So utilizing data insights,
and on top of that,
you know, we use other technologies,

such as AI, machine
learning, data encryption.

There's a massive amount
of integration work
that goes into setting up a customer.

We are able to build and
run that fairly quickly,

without adding additional
cost to our customers or to us
by utilizing AWS.
And most importantly,
we need something that is secure.

And security, cybersecurity
threats, all of those,
that is so important.
Order scalability is significant

from what we do from a
supply chain perspective.
And this is all easy to maintain for us,

running everything on
a AWS managed service.
AWS also offered us innovation credit,

which is super helpful
when you're starting out

and scraping to save costs
when you're a startup.
- Absolutely, the innovation credits

are something that not
everybody knows about,
but they are so helpful to start up,

so I'm so glad that you
utilize the benefit of them.
And Ree, supply chain traceability

has become more and more in
demand, as you mentioned before,
across nearly every single industry.
So, how will iTrazo capture this market,
and how will AWS be able to support you
on the journey of this rapid growth?
- So, firstly, you know,

we have a proven solution
in the marketplace,

which is placing us in a high
esteem amongst our customers.
We've got name brands
that are already on our production system.
We are selling a solution, not a hype.

It is also critical that we
understand our customer needs
and offer more personalized solution,

rather than take the one
size fits all approach.
And having AWS at our disposal,
we are able to build and proof
prototypes and solutions quickly,
and take that to market,

and meet the sort of more
personalized solution,
or the bespoke solutions
that the supply chain demands.

We've got a highly scalable
and secure SAS platform

that is running on AWS,
so that's ticking away.
I can sleep better at night

knowing that my customers
are gonna be supported
while all their applications and processes
are running in the background.
We've also got employee loyalty
from a technical and support resources,
with capability to scale up quickly,
to support multiple projects.
And we are creating the right ecosystem
amongst our partnerships,

and have a strong management
and board and technical team

supporting and building
our brand strategy.
- Thank you so much.

And you mentioned that
you have well known brands
using your system when we spoke earlier.
So can you share who some of these are?

You know, maybe some of your
early adopted customers?
And why did they actually choose iTrazo?
- Well, some of our early adopters
have been in the agriculture sector.
So the agriculture sector
or the food safety/biosecurity concerns
have been driving the traceability,
the supply chain traceability.

So our early adopters have
been the likes of Costa Group,
which is a publicly listed company,
and one of the biggest producers
of fresh produce in Australia.
We've got the Chosen Ones,

which is all stone fruits
based out of Adelaide.

We've got livestock
producers for red meat,

Enduring Station, Grass and
Goats, and multiple others.
And we are also onboarding customers

from the manufacturing, fashion,
health, and pharmaceutical.
And those industries
are all sort of driven by the same thing

in terms of creating
transparency for their industry,
meeting other compliance requirements,
environment sustainability goals.
Let's say pharmaceutical as an example.

Pharmaceutical, by 2024,
all prescription drugs

needs to have traceability
on their products.
And we are working with that industry

and some of the producers
of prescription drugs
in terms of getting traceability.

So, you know, we were very
lucky to have Costa Group
as one of our first customers.
We've continued to work with them,

we've continued to evolve
our platform in that space.
And we are signing up

almost two to three customers
a month at the moment
on our platform.
- Such an exciting space.
Ree, thank you so much.
I always love when a CEO comes on my show,

but even more so when it's
a female in the tech space.

And, you know, when we
were chatting earlier,

you mentioned that 80%
of your staff are female.
That is so cool in this space,
'cause we do know there is a little bit
of a gender discrepancy,

so thank you so much
for sharing your company
and what you guys are doing.

It sounds like you've got
an amazing future ahead.
And if anyone has any questions
about traceability or iTrazo,

please pop them in the
comment section below,
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you much.
- Thank you, Aley.
Thank you, appreciate your time,
and thank you for the opportunity.
